page.title: 15Warsop B.M.X.Club.
page.content: In 1984 the Club was formed with the aim of giving children a safe environment to practise their cycling skills and take part in races. Our school caretaker is a founder member and organiser of the club.It has 93 members of whom 25 are regional champions including the caretaker's son. The Club has strict safety rules insisting on protective clothing and good maintenance of bikes.Members are expected to obey Club rules and set a good example to all B.M.X.riders. A B.M.X.race is always exciting.The speed and height of the jumps is exhilarating. In Sherwood Junior School 71 children own B.M.X.bikes,showing how popular this style of bike has become.B.M.X. competitions are sometimes shown on television.
